snippet.title: The Higgs boson: treated like a rock star Le boson de Higgs en rock star
snippet.description: The Higgs boson: treated like a rock star Le boson de Higgs en rock star / Kate Kahle, on behalf of the CERN Communication Group On 4 July, excited physicists and journalists crowded the CERN site, while around the world thousands tuned in to the webcast, all wanting news of the elusive Higgs boson. News of the Higgs-like boson spread instantaneously via live blogging, news feeds, Twitter, Facebook and other channels [...] BUL-NA-2012-236.- 2012 \- Published in : CERN Bulletin 30/2012 31/2012 Fulltext: PNG;

snippet.title: Pauline Gagnon's Blog: Did we build the LHC just to find the Higgs? Le blog de Pauline Gagnon : A t-on bâti le LHC seulement pour trouver le Higgs ?
snippet.description: Pauline Gagnon's Blog: Did we build the LHC just to find the Higgs? Le blog de Pauline Gagnon : A t-on bâti le LHC seulement pour trouver le Higgs ? / Pauline Gagnon There are bosos and bosons, and if the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) were built only to find the Higgs boson, you would be absolutely right to think all physicists belong to the first category. But the fact is, the LHC does much more than search for Higgs bosons [...] BUL-NA-2011-265.- 2011 \- Published in : CERN Bulletin 41/2011 42/2011 Fulltext: PNG;
